snippet: A jury found Kevin Sutherland guilty of second-degree attempted grand larceny for trying to sell five counterfeit paintings to an undercover police officer.
abstract: New York State Supreme Court jury finds Kevin Sutherland, Florida pastor who dabbles in art dealing, guilty of second-degree attempted grand larceny for trying to sell five counterfeit Damien Hirst paintings to an undercover police officer; case against Sutherland grew out of investigation by the Manhattan district attorney’s office of forger Vincent Lopreto in Laguna Beach, Calif, who has admitted to churning out dozens of fake Hirst works.
lead_paragraph: A jury found Kevin Sutherland guilty of second-degree attempted grand larceny for trying to sell five counterfeit paintings to an undercover police officer.

headline.main: Pastor Is Convicted of Trying to Sell Counterfeit Art
headline.print_headline: Florida Pastor Is Convicted of Trying to Sell Forged Art
